duties_responsibilities.duty: Coordinate and facilitate the development of support plans and assessments for individuals on the caseload.
Provide professional supervision in the day-to-day program management of services for clients with developmental disabilities.
Advocate for appropriate services and assure that the person has choice in all areas of their life.
Assist with locating resources to help individuals achieve their personal goals and increase their independence.
Promote cooperative working relationships and positive team atmosphere both internally and externally with providers, agencies, families, coworkers, and the individuals served.
Complete thorough, accurate, and timely assessments, plans, and other documentation tasks necessary to ensure ongoing funding for services.
Monitor delivery of supports and ensure accurate implementation and data collection of service and support plans.
Develop positive behavioral strategies and supports to assist people with maladaptive behaviors and help increase utilization of positive coping mechanisms.
Conduct announced and unannounced home visits monthly to document contracted living arrangements and satisfaction of the individuals served.
Make weekly phone contact with providers and individuals served to give ongoing support.
Facilitate various requirements such as Host Home Day, IDT meetings, Incident Reports, and QA recommendations.
Collaborate with the Health Services Department and Provider Specialists regarding health and Host Home status of all individuals served.
Help coordinate internal moves for individuals in new Host Homes when the current supports are no longer appropriate.
Provide person-specific training to independent contractors on health and safety requirements, program supports, and required documentation.
Attend workshops, seminars, professional meetings, and internal trainings to keep abreast of current changes in the field.
Follow and exemplify the organization’s vision, mission, and values.
Perform other duties as assigned by supervisor within the scope of the position and reflective of professional experience, education, and ability.
Adhere to the company’s standards of conduct and comply with all company policies, procedures, and protocols.
Passion and commitment to serve persons with developmental disabilities with dignity and acceptance.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor’s Degree in Social Work, Psychology, or closely related field (preferred); or equivalent experience working with individuals with intellectual and developmental disabilities.
